title: Getting Started
desc:
Network Scale Compute (NSC) platform is a shared,
        distributed and managed compute and data storage environment for deploying containerized applications in an enterprise.
author: Roshith CK

title: Its all about Ecosystem
desc:
In the world of Big Data, Hadoop has ruled for a decade. Recently, Hadoop 3 was released,
        but in reality, we believe the world has largely moved to Kubernetes.
author: Håkan Sessle

title: Identity Management and AD Integration of NSC Platform
desc:
Access control and authentication are essential for every system or group of systems/services,
        but does it always have to be tiresome for users? There are ways to manage access control and authentication
author: Sanjay Bardhan

title: My first manifest on NSC
desc:
NSC enables you to use a custom service that you think is appropriate for your needs.
        To use a custom service in NSC, you will require multiple resources such as deployment and service.
author: Roshith CK

title: Helm Chart: Kubernetes Package Manager
desc:
In the current decade, most of the companies have a vast majority of 
        their applications hosted on containers rather than physical servers. 
        This is because containers offer numerous advantages with respect to system management, scalability and flexibility. 
        Helm charts complement containers in several ways.
author: Prathyusha Seelam P

title: Apache Drill
desc:
This blog talks about what is Apache Drill,
        how to launch a Drill cluster on the NSC platform and how to use it to query your data.
author: Tilak Surneni

title: How to use Helm in NSC
desc:
In NSC, Helm can be used to add a custom service. 
        The fact that NSC allows you to use a custom service is one of the USPs of NSC. 
        Let us now go ahead and use Helm in NSC.
author: Prathyusha Seelam P

title: Where did my data go?
desc:
Did you recently say, “Oh no! Not these messages again!” or “What is this?”
        We hear you.
author: Anusha Srinivasan

title: What I need is "my" service
desc:
NSC offers you a service catalog of several popular data analytic services.
        But what about if you don’t find the service you want on the list?
author: Anusha Srinivasan

title: NSC adds CLI support for Helm Chart management
desc:
Are you a fan of Helm Charts? Are you comfortable deploying them for your applications?
        Then, we have good news for you!
author: Anusha Srinivasan

title: Apache Beam with Flink_V0.4
desc:
If you have used Apache Beam for your data processing,
         then you will most likely expect NSC to have it too. In this blog,
          we will tell you how to use Apache Beam in the NSC platform, with Apache Flink Runner.
author: Ganesh Banda

title: NSC makes it "real-time" with Apache NiFi
desc:
"Real-time" is a much-used "buzzword" in many industries,
         but the data analytics industry pretty much defined the term.
          Real-time processing, where digital data is stored, processed, analyzed
author: Anusha Srinivasan

title: Onboarding NSC Users
desc:
This blog will help you understand how we can quickly onboard you, or your team, to NSC. Welcome!
        Before we get into the steps, some prerequisites ...
        You need to have a valid SIGNUM and password.
        The onboarding process involves four steps as shown below.
author: Anusha Srinivasan

title: Let your data flow using StreamSets
desc:
Gone are the days when you had to remember several schemas and codes to
         efficiently manage data operations. You can now make your data consumption-ready,
          for all your analytical activities, using the  StreamSets Data Collector (SDC): a data operations platform.
author: Anusha Srinivasan

title: Freedom to use multiple volumes for custom services
desc:
Until now, the following volume-related restriction has been in force:
        'Every NSC service deployment is associated with just one volume.
        You can choose the desired volume among the ones available for your group...'
author: Anitha Mulcha

title: A 'must read' for AI/ML strategic planners
desc:
We all know that
 AI is essential to every large company’s future business, but how to source and
 establish the necessary infrastructure and resources, and how to structure a
 company to integrate AI are fundamental and vitally important questions.
author: Graham Stanhope

title: Where do I go for help?
desc:
You’ve got a new
  gadget that is going to make your life easier. The gadget’s new to the market, you’re
  inexperienced, you may experience some problems; you need some help.
  You may be in a similar situation with Network Scale Compute (NSC) too. NSC
  will make your analytics jobs easy, but you may need help at times.
author: Anusha Srinivasan

title: Cost comparison for NSC services
desc:
Ericsson Network
Scale Compute (NSC) has matured from an experimental system into a fully capable
and proven commercial offering. While it was once available for free internal
use, it is now a charged service based primarily upon two services...
author: Graham Stanhope
